intro: Scleria rigida, commonly known as rigid sedges, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to various regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically green or brown in color. Scleria rigida is often found in wet or moist habitats such as marshes, stream banks, and swampy areas. Its botanical characteristics make it well-adapted to aquatic or semi-aquatic environments.
